comments.body:
Vote for my update!

 

the mobs for the mob vote are the starfish, a mob from the ocean which can drop items for regen potions, the gysyr, a mob from the nether that sprays smog and fire, and the bull, a neutral mob that can be bred with the cow.

So I do love the idea, but I think that the trading with jungle villagers part is not proper. Villagers from different biomes shouldn't have totally different trading items, unless the actual job is different. So I think that another mob should be added, similar to the Wandering Trader, but this time the Jungle Wanderer. Your ideas would be nice, though.
And also, if it gets chosen if a lot of people vote on it, it probably won't be 1.18, but a later update.
I just want them to overhaul biomes as a whole for 1.18
this would be a bad idea because the only thing that would need to be added is a remade jungle temple

Thank you for your feedback, it is very important to me and shows me where I need to improve.

And remember to tell me what mob you would vote for in my mob vote!
I like the trees, and fish, but no jungle king, its a bit too far.

I think the piranha and dagger thing is a genius idea.  Also I think a few more mobs added to the game for the jungle such as the anaconda which spawns in a new type of tree with large branches. The anaconda would deal 4 heart of damage per bite and it can wrap around you and kill you.  The items dropped would be the snake eye which can be crafted with a bottle to make snake venom like dragon breath except u can make a splash potion of snake venom which can be used on players and mobs.  Another mob that should be added is flamingos, a non-hostile mob that spawns in small lakes and in groups of 5 or less.  Another possible mob is the saltwater crocodile which hides in little sand caves next to the river.  This mob deals 6 hearts of damage and drops something called reptile scales which can be used to make armor (the anaconda also has a chance of dropping this.  The reptile armor would have the same durability of iron armor but easier to obtain.  There are 2 new ores that should also be added which are ruby and sapphire.  These 2 new ores would be mostly like diamond and iron ore.  They would range at about the same durability as each other but is also a step up from iron ore.  Something exclusive about the sapphire ore is that it can make a sapphire sword.  Just a normal sword, no.  When this sword kills any mob the mob will drop and enchanted book.  Could be protection, or sharpness, could even be mending but it must be crafted with a dark ruby gem which is made with a ruby

and a Shadow amethyst which has a 1 out of 500,000 chance of spawning inside of a geode.  This ore would then be the rarest ore in Minecraft.  More rare than diamond and emerald ore combined.  You can make armor and tools out of it as well (stronger than Netherite).  One of the last mobs added to the game would be gorillas and orangutans which would spawn naturally in the jungle.  The last mob that is an okay idea kind of like the axolotl in the 1.17 update that's coming out.  Added to the game because of it being endangered and rare.  This mob is known as the pink dolphin which could be found  in a new jungle biome known as the river.  I'm just saying it would be nice to see some of these guys in our minecraft world sometimes.  I hope these ideas are good enough for the game as I have been thinking of them for a while now.
Jungle villages should be high in Jungle trees with bridges connecting them, like the ewok villages in Star Wars.
Also there should be mud blocks that are kind of brown versions of powder snow. And grass can spread on top of mud which will make it harder to see.
chjg

I love this idea, maybe the void dimension could be the “in between” of the overworld and nether and you can go through the roof of the void dimension through the floor overworld and the floor of the void dimension through the roof of the nether.
We have already too many flowers
vibrant green
we need a maroon colour

To piggy back off of this:

Mesa Biome ores using the different terracotta blocks

The Mesa Biome looks very strange with clay on top and then once you enter a cave, it's suddenly stone. It would be nice for the gold ore to spawn in the existing terracotta block types. It would also be nice for the clay to extend into the mountains to really sell the idea of colored layers. Basically, after you get below y=something, the clay is no more and stone starts again.
Also could potentially silver, rubies, bronze and copper.
Good idea

Dr. Thezbi Kazo approves but dosnt largly support this idea.

Cool.

I like this idea but one post that is under review is about giving the biomes seasons and that would kinda make this idea useless. I do fully agree that the birch forest needs an upgrade. Maybe they’ll add a new animal to it soon.
I agree. I also think that the birch trees need to be a tad bit taller and skinnier. Including the idea of trees, why not add simple physics when you cut them down?

I really like this idea, but I can see how it would cause problems with players that have bases in birch forests.

Maybe instead of changing the texture of all Birch Leaves, a new biome could be added that makes grass and leaves become Autumn coloured? This biome would become the standard Birch Biome, but it would still allow players in older chunks of their world to have the boring leaves/grass. Its a bit of a cheap way to add this, but I think it would still be good.
Birch wood could also look less like a cow

I don't think many people are aware of the tall birch forest biome. It's slightly different and is somehow more appealing to me. The leaves would probably be nice iin a season-oriented change, but I don't think anything of the like would be implemented soon
We have a snowy version of plains and taigas, so maybe we could have an autumn version of oak and birch forests?
Maybe instead all leaves and grass being orange, there could be slight variation with a hue map? Hues would change between red and orange and yellow between different locations in the biome.

the max was 1500 characters so here's the rest

The Enemies:

There would be a couple new types of spiders, to start off with there would be one that paralyzes you with an acid spiting attack, not stopping you but giving you slowness. A spider queen that would be the boss to the for mentioned cave labyrinth. A new zombie that gives you slowness when he attacks you, reasoning being he was a previous victim to the spiders and now serves there queen. I also say a rework for the spiders in general should be down because they're so clunky in the first place. Like if I had a dollar for every time I saw a spider just sitting on the ceiling not attacking me I'd actually have more than 1000 dollars. I think the should have the ability to climb on the ceiling and sides of walls to try and juke you when attacking, sort of like in deep rock galactic. 

New Blocks and Items

A couple new decoration blocks like webbed dirt, wood, stone, and stone brick. Though you would only obtain them with silk touch and breaking them with anything else just gives you string. New crafting materials like spider legs, dropped from the queen, too let you create a new chest piece making you blend in more if you were to visit the another Arachnid Forrest. Also a new projectile shot from a crossbow only called a spider gland. It would drop from the spitter spider and would deal a little under what a arrow would deal but would be able to slow mobs.
yeah minecraft needs this sort of stuff
You could also add other Arachnids, like crabs and scorpions
You could also add other Arachnids, like crabs and scorpions

Could be interesting, sounds pretty similar to the roofed forest though. Same sort of feel. But I can see how adding an entire biome Dedicated to spiders could be uneasy for arachniphobes. I'm not arachnophobic but I could see that being something to consider.

I'd think it would be cool.
I consider myself an arachnophobe because I've gotten scared from Minecraft spiders

There are species of Spiders that create nests that are massive, covering trees and land.

I think a small rare biome in Minecraft would be awesome for this reason.  Many of the ideas above in this comment thread are pretty good.  

Perhaps in the nests there's a small chance for a boss battle with a giant spider?

 

Also ... the biome would give people a reason to have Bane of Arthropods ;)

I think the Spider Queen boss battle could be awesome. Maybe have it so tall that you have to cut each leg down to hit the main body.
As for a reward, maybe a special type of web to construct a new weapon or a fang for a new weapon or potion.

I am not sure about having a boss in the forest. I would recommend it being a sub biome of a forest, (sort of like the bamboo is in the jungle.) I also think that the spiders should be docile during the day as they are currently.  Maybe a specialized smaller variant of spiders, (not sure about acid spitting zombie variants etc.) I fell it should be more of an environment than a "minigame" 

I have posted an idea of a web block that contains treasure which would lure players into the forest to explore. Then as night falls the spiders will attack. being that every surface is covered in webs movement in this forest will be slowed, so the deeper you go in, the more likely I would make it to have treasure spawn, but the more risky it would be to be able to get out before nightfall.

Even having spider egg nests clusters that could be broken by stepping on it, (similar to the way turtle eggs break when tread on. and the nbaby spiders would attack as they would be provoked by the crushing of eggs..

I do like the idea of the webs extending down into the caves, though not a generated one or a labyrinth. You want it to feel like spiders have taken over. 

Trees should have fewer leaves if any and blocks coated in webbing with cobwebs scattered around.

Generally I like the concept.
No it should be a portal that you can make with the ender egg so it has a purpuse

I love this idea! It needs to happen! We could have eucalyptus trees and she oaks. We could have a lot of different Aussie animals, the iconic ones, but also a few lesser-known animals like cassowaries. Of course, we should also incorporate drop-bears. If you don’t know what they are, they are a ferocious creature native to Australia. They closely resemble koalas, but they are larger and have sharp claws and teeth. There is this new ridiculous and harmful idea that they are a hoax. As a person who has lived in Australia my whole life, I can confirm they are not a hoax. You can find more information about them on National Geographic. Anyway, they could be a rare mob that lives in eucalyptus trees and can jump on players passing by.
mmmmm yummy
Great idea! I would love to see emus and kangaroos as well as Eucalyptus trees, it would just be a cool new biome for Minecraft and it might even have some new type of sand or something!

This would be amazing. It might be best as a large island or generally larger biome so we get the Australia experience with it.

They did a bit of this when they showed the new Forest biome in the nether. It's okay, but the game really needs a fourth dimension for the players that keep playing
I think this content should be placed in the root forest. There's already some magical energy there that causes giant mushrooms to grow these.
While I certainly agree that the game needs a fourth dimension, I think it would be cool to have a forest similar to this found underground in the Overworld

My post was too similar so I had to post here:

Bioluminescent Forest

Filled with glowing fungus, clear-water lakes, and fluorescent trees, these forests can be found in large underground areas. But why would players want to travel here? Well, why do they want to travel anywhere? One reason is the scenery.

This biome is so awe-inspiring that any who stumble upon it when mining probably won't want to leave. The trees are giant with beautiful leaves weeping down from the branches. On the trunks of the trees you can find Foxfire Fungi - clusters of small green glowing mushrooms. The floor of the biome is made up of Alien Soil. On the floor of the forest, Ghost Mushrooms can be found. Hanging from the ceiling of the cave are glow worm threads.

Another reason to go here is to gather the various items of the peculiar forest. Foxfire fungi, obtainable with silk touch, can be used in brewing to make a potion of emitting light. Ghost Mushrooms can glow pink, orange, teal, or green and are good decorations for lighting. Fissured Concrete, crafted from bioluminescence, has cracks that emit light and can serve as a good path. Silk from cocoons can be used to craft parachutes.

Even without mobs, this forest sounds amazing, right? To make things better, here are some of my ideas for mobs of the forest:

Crystal Fox

Butterflies and Caterpillars

Fireflies

Jellyfish

Bright Tree Villagers

Tree Golem
This should be the forth demension that would be sweet
I really like this idea. Maybe you have to use blue ice for the portal. Also there should be snowy giant taiga biomes as well
I think this is a cool idea, there should be more mobs though, like dodos, passenger pigeons, great auks, short faced bears, moas, and haast eagles. I would replace the bison with the aurochs too.
also, you should be able to create a world that only has a selection of biomes (ie. tundra, ice spikes, & cold taiga) as opposed to just one.
this should also be in bedrock, because in bedrock we cannot customize our worlds in this way.
Considering that the game is being treated more like a pure sandbox recently, this would be great.
This sounds like a good Nether biome. Maybe it is also composed of a decent amount of basalt and magma blocks. It could also spawn more magma cubes than normal.
This would be one of my favorite bioms if it would exist

Sounds amazing, just a few problems, unless you're going for the black-orange vibe I'm worried it will look too much like the soul sand valley. I think basalt pillars could help support the roof of the biome; I love the geysers but I think spitting out resources could be a little overpowered.

Still could be a brilliant place for Nether gold ore to spawn more commonly. I was interested whether cinder weeds would have saplings or fungi or are they actually burnt fungi? I think it could be interesting if flammables like overworld planks just spontaneously sets on fire there.
They should have husks spawn in them, as they seem like deserts with more loot than usual.

I like this idea but sea temples couldn't hold guardians because (I'm assuming) there is no water, which makes it an easy place to loot. But if it was abandoned with not very much loot, then this idea is perfect. Especially in deserts. The same thing goes for other underwater structures.
i did forget to add there would be challenging mobs, such husks, and other things. there would be less loot than the real temples. you can also find buried treasure
This was something I thought about ages ago and I started building a dried ocean floor, for a build project
Pls add salt blocks.

I agree have an new portal because the people choose new dragon or more dragon needs new place because it can not be the same place as enderdragons right?? also nether and ends only those two place we can teleport too I think I want to descover more places other then ends and Nether .

I say we need an sculck world and i say you should make the boss fight an elder warden witch in fact i put in my little comic plus the elder warden is from the dinosaur /cave man age and its huge and it can be dangerous but it can become an statue too but its an sculck one though

Perhaps this biome could have traces of radioactive matter, such as plutonium, or uranium. If this biome is added, radioactive ores can be added with it, and can be used to craft nuclear reactors, which use plutonium for high power outputs, and uranium for lower ones, with Irradium encasing the nuclear cell, which would have a redstone output line in it.
I like the idea of a musket
Different, but related (one is above ground, this is below): https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360018513552-luminescent-forest

Yea, exactly, underground biomes where light is important. As it stands currently we are limited on light emitting blocks,

Pickles, sea lanterns, torches, redstone torch, glowstone, end rods, jack o lanterns for stand alone blocks, redstone lamps take up a 2 block space and require redstone torches or levers or other block to power it.
I would love to see this, even if they overhaul the already existing mushroom island by adding it to the caves in that biome.
Mushroom shelves could be cool

Cool idea, but these new mushrooms can grow on the surface as well, but only in rare locations or somewhere sheltered, also some enchanted biomes we need of and they can spawn in there too, also a variant of Mooshrooms with glowing mushrooms on then, the colours of these mushrooms comes in blue, green, turquoise, purple and so on, so yeah

I really like this.  It’s sort of like a fairy tale dimension.  I have some suggestions.

1. The portal is only able to be activated in the nether.

2. Magic only has an effect in this dimension.

3. Try to cut down on the number of new items and ores.

4. Mobs from this dimension cannot spawn in the overworld, and only good witches can travel through the portals to the overworld.

5. All mobs with an attack immediately attack hostile mobs from the overworld.

6. This dimension should be kept separate from the other dimensions as much as possible in order to avoid overpowered items and mobs.

7. There is no need for new types of trees.  Wood and leaves and saplings just have different colors in this dimension.

Thank you for reading and giving feedback.

 

1.  The portal only being able to be activated in the Nether would be an interesting twist.

2. As I said in the magic post in response to this, that would make it not worthwhile to do the work to unlock the spells.

3. If I have too many new items and ores, the devs are more than free to do some judicious pruning.  However, I wanted to make sure to have enough new items to allow for the new spell crafting.

4. I absolutely agree that mobs from this dimension would not spawn elsewhere.  I would be fine if the mobs can't go through the portal.  Although they should be able to exist in the other dimensions.

5. Them attacking hostile overworld mobs sounds like a nice feature.

6. If you think the magic system is overpowered, could you try to explain how, rather than just trying to keep it isolated from everything else?  It goes from being possibly overpowered to basically worthless if it doesn't introduce new abilities to general use.

7. I don't understand this at all.  New colors on overworld trees would just be incredibly boring.
I feel like this should be a magical version of the overworld.  That is why I think magic, magical creatures, and colorful trees should only apply in this dimension.

In a lot of respects, I also think of this as a magical/fantasy version of the overworld.  But I'm also thinking about how it would affect gameplay, or not.

People love the challenge of capturing mobs and moving them between dimensions, for example.  Although I agree absolutely that the Wyverns specifically should not be able to go through the portal, because I assume that Mojang does not want a flying mount in the other dimensions.  And if it can go through the portal, Mythos should be gated after The End by including an End item in the portal (or requiring it to be opened in The End?) to prevent people from having a flying mount in their first Dragon fight.

Also, as fun as I hope it would be to explore Mythos, I can't imagine the spell system being used much if the spells aren't at all functional in the other dimensions.  The magic issue is why I have it so that the magical recharge on the spelled items happens slower in the other dimensions. There has to be some level of magic force in the other dimensions for enchanted items to work, but it's different from the magic in Mythos. The amber used in all spell crafting acts as a battery and a magical converter.

None of the other flora that is special to other dimensions is limited to the other dimensions, as long as you have the correct thing to grow it on.  Nether Wort can be grown anywhere as long as it's on Soul Sand, and Chorus Flowers can grow anywhere as long as it's on End Stone.  Either the soil in Mythos is special and you need to have some of that to grow the Mythos trees, or it uses normal dirt.  Either way, it would be a new precedent for them to be unable to grow in other dimensions.  The lack of ability to grow the new trees elsewhere would make them harder to farm for their wood and prevent them from being used as decorative accents or integral parts of builds anywhere but inside Mythos.

I dunno… putting direct witch and witchraft references in will cause a lot of parents to pull their kids from the platform and encourage a lot of 'told you so's'.  So you might want to refine the idea a little bit imho.

I actually like the chance of having a flying mount to fight the ender dragon on, that's a nice twist - similar to the conduit for the ocean monument.  If you notice, you cannot activate a conduit until you have defeated the elder guardians as its impossible to mine enough prismarine until you do so.

Based on the above, I would say, have a little more faith in the devs, designers and project managers to work it out between them.

I hope that wouldn't be the case, but then again, there are people who think Harry Potter is evil, so........  Honestly, I would be sad if fear of people like that caused this idea to be changed.

 

However, as with almost anything in this idea, I defer to the devs for tweaks and changes.  If having a "good witch" is deemed something that will cause too many problems, the name can be changed.  (the friend who helped me and wrote the lore was the main driving force in them being called "good witches".  They could be called mages, etc.  Although that would also somewhat require dumping the part of the lore where they go to the overworld after they defeat the dark magic.)

If the actual fact of a magic system is what you're talking about...  There's not much I can do about that.  At least it's not like the Blood Magic mod.

I really hope this post picks up traction.
Sounds like you want a dimension with a portal nearly identical to an End portal, with a boss nearly identical to the Wither.

@Bilbo Baggins, that is a great point you brought up; however I wasn't exactly focusing on the boss, but I figured if this idea did get created I would hope the people who actually create this idea could make it more distinct from that. I wasn't really aiming for something like that. I thought by having some sort of boss in the realm would make players more interested with this idea. The big picture I would like to see happen is a realm that is more like undead. Compared to the Nether realm which basically seems like a demonic realm and the End world seems like some kind of shadow realm. The realm I would like to see is this new realm (NAME DOESN'T MATTER of Realm) to resemble the starting realm, but everything seems dead and tougher to fight. I also thought it would draw more players to included common creatures such as werewolves or vampires since they easily could fit that realm domain. The other big picture is having the boss to re-spawn over the course of a certain amount of game days. I would like to see this boss as more of a pest then actually a 5 min. battle. So I thought its main ability should be some sort of necromancy that affected the real world during the night as long as the portal to the realm stays open, as long as the boss is alive, or something else creative.

Thanks for the feedback!
A dead demonic realm seems a lot like the nether, though.

Sort of, however I would see werewolf's, vampires, and skeletons/other undead creatures to fit in the category of Necromancy more then a Demonic category (Both are branches of some form of evil). The Nether world seems more to represent a place that looks similar to hell. I would like to see this realm look more of a cemetery/ghost town kind of realm. I think its okay to have this realm have a few common features like the Nether since it should consist of mostly unholy creatures.
Nice,but the boss is way too OP. Maybe you could add that as an option to be able to use or not.
Nice,but the boss is way too OP. Maybe you could add that as an option to be able to use or not.
